thread.title: Laurelhurst Market’s ‘Five-Napkin Chicken’ Goes Brick and Mortar
thread.title_full: Laurelhurst Market’s ‘Five-Napkin Chicken’ Goes Brick and Mortar

author: Mattie John Bamman
title: Laurelhurst Market’s ‘Five-Napkin Chicken’ Goes Brick and Mortar
text: Mattie John Bamman/EPDX Last summer, chef Ben Bettinger fired up a 14-foot smoker in the parking lot of Laurelhurst Market , Portland’s best steakhouse , to serve chicken slathered in a signature take on Alabama white sauce. That chicken was one of the stars of the summer, and it’ll soon return, The O reports : Bettinger and the rest of the Laurelhurst team are opening a brick and mortar called Big's Chicken . And it’ll add whole chickens and more to those juicy thighs. Big’s Chicken will set up shop in the venue formerly home to Big Ass Sandwiches , at 5663 NE Glisan St. — tentatively next month. Also on the Big’s Chicken menu are Laurelhurst Market’s house sausages, barbecue whole and half chickens, on-tap beers, and a few cocktails. Speaking with Eater last summer, Bettinger said the “Five-Napkin Chicken” idea was the result of a trip to Columbus, OH. "We ate a ton of hot chicken," said Bettinger. As hot chicken is native to Nashville, those flocks are clearly migrating across the nation.
